data.title: Charbroiled Oysters to die for
data.text: I went with friends for a late lunch on Saturday.  The Half Shell salad and charbroiled oysters were the perfect combination. Topped off with a crisp white wine. Fabulous in every way.  Our server, Jason, was personable and efficient.  I love the atmosphere there.

data.title: One of the best Gulf Coast purveyors of good seafood in a pleasant setting.
data.text: Located in a former bank building in downtown Gulfport, this is a favorite friendly service, quality food and reasonable prices. My favorite is a side dish, asparagus in a tempura-like batter. Oysters are available in numerous forms, raw, charbroiled, etc. For the big appetite, there is a fried oyster po'boy, a Gulf Coast variation of the New Orleans classic.

data.title: Great food!
data.text: Had this last night after a day of sailing.  The food was awesome as was our waitress.  I had the blackened grouper which wasn't too heavy on the seasoning and my husband had the grilled sampler plate that was also yummy. Their chocolate dessert was to die for although I can't recall the name!  Highly recommend this restaurant, the inside looks really neat too.

data.title: We love Half Shell.
data.text: We love Half Shell. Great Filet. Service is good. The Broiled oysters are the best around. Been to both locations and never have they disappointed

data.title: Yum
data.text: We walked in and I have to admit, it was bumpy at first. Our waiter took at least 5 minutes to even get to us, but it ended up awesome! If you drink martinis, i must proclaim that the caramel apple martini is a must. The bisque and half shell salad are to die for! The voodoo wings are boneless morsels of perfection! If I had a complaint, the lobster macaroni (I stress LOBSTER...it had tons) had too much cheese...it was good, but the consistency was more liquid than I would have liked. We got 2 bananas foster cheesecakes to go and they were egh (too much rum). All in all, half shell is our go to when we hang out in downtown Gulfport.

data.title: Great food but pricey for what you get
data.text: This was number one for Gulfport so we wanted to give it a try. 2 adults 2 kids bill was $100. We had charbroiled oysters and i have had better for sure and not enough bread given to dip in the butter...and thats the best part. Seafood platter was $26 and you literally got one piece of fish and i do not mean a whole filet i mean one piece, 4 shrimp, 6 of the smallest fried oysters i have ever seen, i do not like them large but this was probably cut in half or something, a small stuffed crab and 4 hush puppies. My husband and i always get a seafood platter or similar dish and a dozen oysters to split but we have never gotten a platter this small before. We had a seafood pasta which was probably the best thing ordered and crab claws for my daughter. So by all means give it a try the food is good but dont waste your money on the seafood platter and dont expect to share it even with a dozen oysters.

data.title: Fabulous family time
data.text: Totally enjoyed our dinner. Last night in Gulfport and picked the right place. Food was excellent. Started with Crab cake and fried green tomatoes and the oyster sampler(yum!). Then redfish, grouper and more crab cakes. Our three year old grandson was treated like a celebrity by the manager. Service and all. Thank you!

data.title: yummy!
data.text: love this place, it not only has great food but prices are not so bad. also go for the oysters- they are a must

data.title: Mother's Day Lunch
data.text: Always a great meal when we go to The Half Shell!  We went with family to celebrate Mother's Day. We started with oysters (Bienville and Rockefeller), they were perfect!  If you like oysters, I definitely recommend getting these!!  I got The Almond Chicken Salad as my meal and was not disappointed. It was delicious and a perfect size. I highly recommend going to The Half Shell. The staff is courteous and professional and the atmosphere is perfect.

data.title: Great as always
data.text: This is without a doubt my favorite restaurant in the area.  My wife and my mother and I were there last night.  We used the call ahead seating and had a five minute wait for a table on Friday night during the busy time.  I ordered the bacon and pecan crusted redfish that was fantastic.  It had a slightly sweet flavor that really was different, but enjoyable.  My wife ordered (as always) the oyster sampler and I had to keep her from ordering the second one.  Mom loved the fried shrimp.  Our sever Tim was great and did a great job for us.  If you are in Gulfport you want to make this one or more of your dining experiences.

data.title: Great restaurant; great ambience
data.text: We were spending one night in Gulfport and had dinner here.  It was fabulous.  We split an order of the voodoo shrimp and the broccoli.  I had the house salad.  All of it was 5 star!!!  As was the bread pudding dessert we split.  The waiter could have definitely been better.  Never got any silverware until after we got food and we had to ask for it.  Also had to ask for a glass of water.  But other than that, the place was delightful.  Would definitely recommend it.  We also got seated right away without a reservation.  Maybe the waiter was just having a bad night.

data.title: Delicious seafood
data.text: We enjoyed two dinners at Half Shell Oyster House during our week's stay in Gulfport, MS.  The royal red's (large shrimp that taste like lobster) were delicious as were the cheese/bacon creamy grits ordered for the side.

data.title: I've had better
data.text: It's not cheap to eat here, but the drinks are inexpensive. I'm not a big eater, so I decided to go for appetizers. Oyster sampler was a let down for me, just about every other bite, I had shell grinding in my teeth (YUCK!). The Royal Red, I did the half pound, I was sitting there picking out the poop line of the shrimp. In the end, I lost interests. I get it, they're seafoods and they're supposed to taste like they are from the water it came from..... but I've had better. So, unsatisfied with the former two choices, I decided to go for the Voodoo chicken. I won't go back to the restaurant again.

data.title: Kiss the cooks but not the service!
data.text: This is the second time I attempt to write a review and for some reason, my previous review was not posted so I will try again.  The restaurant was beautiful and the food was absolutely delicious.  The service however was a different story.  Having arrived early for dinner, we were greeted at the door by two young ladies who seemed to be interested in anything but us.  Walking up to our table, I requested if it was possible to be seated on the second level.  The young lady seemed very disturbed by my request and said OK but not after rolling her eyes and sighing very deeply.  Our waiter was about as friendly as she was and at one point was very insulting.  This insult was a result of me asking for a new pepper shaker because the one on the table had about three pepper seeds in it and it was difficult to get any seasoning out of it.  He took the shaker, proceeded to grind the seeds ON THE TABLE as if to say, no there is plenty left.  He then asked if I wanted him to season my salad; I declined and shortly after that brought me a new pepper shaker.  Also, considering the beauty of the restaurant and the quality of this franchise, I also was taken back by the fact that he did not offer cold beer glasses for our beer and after bringing some upon request, watched us pour our own into the glass and never once offered to pour it for us.  It may seem trivial but at finer restaurants this is done for their customers.  We did rise above this and leave an 18% tip but would have left a larger one had the waiter been more attentive.  As Julie Roberts said in Pretty Woman..."Mistake, big Mistake!"  As we left the restaurant, the young lady at the hostess table never said a word...not "Good night", "Come back" , or "Thank you"!  We were not disappointed in the food but the service left us no choice but not to return again!

data.title: No service for lunch
data.text: We walked in the door and stood for probably 4-5 minutes with staff walking past but no one to seat us---no one spoke at all. We left and ate somewhere else. It was not really busy either---very strange.

data.title: Delicious Flavorful Seafood
data.text: I stopped here for a business meeting for a party of 6. We met at 11am and was immediately sat. The waitress quickly took our drink orders. We ordered the grilled oysters Orleans as a starter. They were outstanding. For lunch, I ordered the blackened redfish with sides of turnip greens and broccoli. The food was great. The service was too!

data.title: Very good seafood
data.text: This is my daughters favorite place to eat, it's good, but not my favorite. The staff is outstanding, never had an empty glass, their were right on top of everything. My favorite shrimp are the Royal Reds, "deep water shrimp that taste like lobster."

data.title: Did someone say oyster!
data.text: I am in Gulfport once a year. This is the place I go first. If you like oysters this is the place. They are raw or cooked. They have a great bar setup in case you have to wait. Try the oysters Orleans for an app.

data.title: Great place to celebrate
data.text: Dinner was great! We started out with Charbroiled Oysters. They were the best I ever had. They weren't big, which is perfect for me. The Royal Reds were huge and delicious. The Sweet Potato Creme Brûlée was top notch. Fried shrimp were big and good. The kids Shrimp was big and we had to steal some of their French fries, the coating was super!

data.title: Southern experience
data.text: As a boy from Colorado, I had a few friends that wanted to show me a little southern cuisine. This was some of the best flavor and best food I've had. I would definitely recommend!! Good food at a great price.
